body:
Also, weirdly enough a similar crash also happens in `RefactoringChecker` if I tweak the code a little bit:

### Code
```python
class Foo:
    def __init__(self, foo=slice(42)):
        self.foo = foo


def bar():
    i = Foo()
    i.foo()
    return 100
```

### Output

```bash
************* Module asd
Exception on node <FunctionDef.bar l.6 at 0x1025149a0> in file '/tmp/asd.py'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/private/tmp/venv3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pylint/utils/ast_walker.py", line 95, in walk
    callback(astroid)
  File "/private/tmp/venv3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pylint/checkers/refactoring/refactoring_checker.py", line 977, in leave_functiondef
    self._check_consistent_returns(node)
  File "/private/tmp/venv3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pylint/checkers/refactoring/refactoring_checker.py", line 1859, in _check_consistent_returns
    ) and self._is_node_return_ended(node):
  File "/private/tmp/venv3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pylint/checkers/refactoring/refactoring_checker.py", line 1971, in _is_node_return_ended
    return any(self._is_node_return_ended(_child) for _child in node.get_children())
  File "/private/tmp/venv3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pylint/checkers/refactoring/refactoring_checker.py", line 1971, in <genexpr>
    return any(self._is_node_return_ended(_child) for _child in node.get_children())
  File "/private/tmp/venv3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pylint/checkers/refactoring/refactoring_checker.py", line 1971, in _is_node_return_ended
    return any(self._is_node_return_ended(_child) for _child in node.get_children())
  File "/private/tmp/venv3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pylint/checkers/refactoring/refactoring_checker.py", line 1971, in <genexpr>
    return any(self._is_node_return_ended(_child) for _child in node.get_children())
  File "/private/tmp/venv3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pylint/checkers/refactoring/refactoring_checker.py", line 1941, in _is_node_return_ended
    if self._is_function_def_never_returning(funcdef_node):
  File "/private/tmp/venv3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pylint/checkers/refactoring/refactoring_checker.py", line 2000, in _is_function_def_never_returning
    return node.qname() in self._never_returning_functions
AttributeError: 'Slice' object has no attribute 'qname'
/tmp/asd.py:1:0: F0002: /tmp/asd.py: Fatal error while checking '/tmp/asd.py'. Please open an issue in our bug tracker so we address this. There is a pre-filled template that you can use in '/Users/tusharsadhwani/Library/Caches/pylint/pylint-crash-2023-01-17-15-02-58.txt'. (astroid-error)
```

issue.title: AttributeError: 'Slice' object has no attribute 'name' when a slice is used as a class decorator

labels.name: Crash ðŸ’¥
labels.description: A bug that makes pylint crash

labels.name: Needs PR
labels.description: This issue is accepted, sufficiently specified and now needs an implementation

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
### Bug description

While triaging https://github.com/pylint-dev/astroid/issues/2721, I triggered an `AttributeError` in Pylint:

```python
s = slice(-2)
@s()
class a: ...
```

Here's a similar issue that was fixed: https://github.com/pylint-dev/pylint/issues/8067

### Configuration

```ini

```

### Command used

```shell
pylint crash.py
```

### Pylint output

```python
Exception on node <ClassDef.a l.3 at 0x72df671d8690> in file 'crash.py'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "pylint/utils/ast_walker.py", line 87, in walk
    callback(astroid)
  File "pylint/checkers/base/basic_error_checker.py", line 212, in visit_classdef
    self._check_redefinition("class", node)
  File "pylint/checkers/base/basic_error_checker.py", line 518, in _check_redefinition
    defined_self = next(
                   ^^^^^
  File "pylint/checkers/base/basic_error_checker.py", line 519, in <genexpr>
    (local for local in redefinitions if not utils.is_overload_stub(local)),
                                             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "pylint/checkers/utils.py", line 1676, in is_overload_stub
    return bool(decorators and decorated_with(node, ["typing.overload", "overload"]))
                               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "pylint/checkers/utils.py", line 875, in decorated_with
    if any(
       ^^^^
  File "pylint/checkers/utils.py", line 876, in <genexpr>
    i.name in qnames or i.qname() in qnames
    ^^^^^^
AttributeError: 'Slice' object has no attribute 'name'
```

### Expected behavior

No crash

### Pylint version

pylint: 70559b880f8fd
astroid: pylint-dev/astroid@ce81c290efa
Python 3.13.2

### OS / Environment

Arch Linux

### Additional dependencies

```python

```

issue.title: AttributeError: 'Slice' object has no attribute 'qname' in code_style checker

labels.name: Crash ðŸ’¥
labels.description: A bug that makes pylint crash

labels.name: Needs PR
labels.description: This issue is accepted, sufficiently specified and now needs an implementation

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
### Bug description

The code_style checker crashes on this code from #8067:

```python
x = slice(42)
x()
```

### Configuration

```ini

```

### Command used

```shell
pylint --enable-all-extensions crash.py
```

### Pylint output

```python-traceback
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "pylint/pylint/utils/ast_walker.py", line 87, in walk
    callback(astroid)
    ~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^
  File "pylint/pylint/extensions/code_style.py", line 118, in visit_call
    if called.qname() == "collections.namedtuple":
       ^^^^^^^^^^^^
AttributeError: 'Slice' object has no attribute 'qname'. Did you mean: 'frame'?
```

### Expected behavior

No crash

### Pylint version

pylint: bb9df163919
astroid: pylint-dev/astroid@bd6e3049db110
Python 3.13.7

### OS / Environment

Arch Linux

### Additional dependencies

```python

```
